title: Tetbury Railway Walk Route

images.title: Forester2009, CC BY-SA 3.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/3.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Old railway line out of Tetbury

images.title: Paul Best / Station Yard Tetbury
images.caption: Station Yard Tetbury. Entrance to the former G.W.R goods yard at Tetbury this is now a car park.

images.title: Paul Best / Feoffees sign at Herd Lane Tetbury.
images.caption: Feoffees sign at Herd Lane Tetbury. This sign can be found at the entrance of Herd Lane, Tetbury. The areas of Preston Park, Berkeley Wood and Herd Lane have been provided and maintained as leisure and amenity facilities for use by the public at their own risk and all due care should be taken when using these facilities. By order of The Feoffees of Tetbury.

images.title: Sarah Charlesworth / Disused Railway Workshop in Tetbury
images.caption: Disused Railway Workshop in Tetbury

images.title: Forester2009, CC BY-SA 3.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/3.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Park above the railway

images.title: Paul Best / Tetbury Branch Line Track Bed
images.caption: Tetbury Branch Line Track Bed

description: A circular walk along the course of the old railway line in Tetbury. You can start the walk from the Station Yard car park in the town centre. Then follow a tree lined footpath heading north east along the line before returning along Herd Lane. At the north eastern end of the route you will come to Wor Well, the Source of the River Avon. It's an easy walk running for a distance of just under 2 miles. There's also a park surrounding the peaceful area. The single-track branch railway line connected Tetbury with the main line at Kemble on the line between Swindon and Gloucester. It was opened in 1889 and then closed in 1964.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: For more walking ideas in the area see the Cotswolds Walks and the Gloucestershire Walks pages.
